words.translation: A greeting used when meeting someone

courses.name: Basic Vocabulary
courses.description: Essential everyday English words for beginners

words.translation: A greeting used when meeting someone
words.distractors: A farewell expression used when parting,An expression of gratitude for a gift,A polite term for requesting something
A common way to start a conversation,A word to show appreciation or thanks,A term for a young human being
An apology for a mistake,A request for permission,A way to say no politely
A word to show thanks for a favor,A way to express sorrow or regret,A response when offered something

words.translation: Used to express regret or apologize
words.distractors: An expression of joy or happiness,A polite term to ask for something,A word indicating agreement

words.translation: A person you like and enjoy spending time with
words.distractors: A person one works with professionally,An individual one does not know,A group consisting of parents and children

words.translation: A group of related people (e.g., parents, children, siblings)
words.distractors: A collection of individuals with a common interest,A person who teaches in a school,A place where people live

words.translation: Substances that people or animals eat to live and grow
words.distractors: Clear liquid essential for life,A building used for residence,A vehicle for transportation

words.translation: Clear, odorless, tasteless liquid essential for all known forms of life
words.distractors: Sweet, edible part of a plant, typically a fruit,Nourishment consumed to sustain life,A place where goods are sold

words.translation: A building where people live, typically a single-family dwelling
words.distractors: An institution for education of children,A vehicle with four wheels for road travel,A large outdoor area for recreation

words.translation: Used to express affirmation, agreement, or consent
words.distractors: Used to express negation or refusal,Indicates uncertainty or possibility,A greeting used upon arrival

words.translation: Used to express negation, disagreement, or refusal
words.distractors: Indicates agreement or acceptance,A polite expression of thanks,A word showing sorrow for an action

words.translation: Of considerable size, extent, or intensity
words.distractors: Of less than average size or amount,Feeling pleasure or contentment,Moving or capable of moving at high speed

words.translation: Of a size that is less than average or usual
words.distractors: Large in physical extent or bulk,Of a good or satisfactory quality,Occurring in a short time or at a fast pace

words.translation: To be desired or approved of; of high quality
words.distractors: Of poor quality or a low standard,Feeling or showing pleasure,Not large in size or amount

words.translation: Of poor quality or a low standard; not good
words.distractors: Excellent or desired; of high standard,Unhappy or expressing sorrow,Large in physical dimensions

words.translation: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment
words.distractors: Feeling sorrow or unhappiness,Angry or annoyed,Tired or in need of sleep
Joyful or pleased about something,Moving with quickness,Having a great size

words.translation: To put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it
words.distractors: To take liquid into the mouth and swallow,To rest in a state of reduced consciousness,To move at a speed faster than walking

words.translation: To take (a liquid) into the mouth and swallow
words.distractors: To consume solid food by chewing and swallowing,To communicate using spoken words,To form letters or words on a surface

words.translation: To rest your mind and body by being unconscious
words.distractors: To become conscious after sleeping,To perform tasks, typically for payment,To engage in activities for enjoyment

words.translation: To move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all feet on the ground at the same time
words.distractors: To move at a regular and fairly slow pace,To rest in a seated position,To be in an upright position on one's feet

words.translation: To move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once
words.distractors: To move rapidly on foot,To travel through the air using wings,To propel oneself through water using limbs

words.translation: To look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter)
words.distractors: To mark letters or symbols on a surface,To perceive sounds with the ears,To express thoughts or feelings by using voice

words.translation: To mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen or pencil
words.distractors: To understand written or printed words,To create pictures with a pen or pencil,To input text using a keyboard

words.translation: An institution for educating children or young people
words.distractors: A place for treating sick or injured people,A building containing collections of books,A place where goods are bought and sold

words.translation: A person who teaches, especially in a school or college
words.distractors: A person studying at an educational institution,A qualified medical practitioner,A person who cultivates land or raises livestock

words.translation: A person who is studying at a school, college, or university
words.distractors: An individual who imparts knowledge,The head of a school,A person in charge of a library

words.translation: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together, bound in covers
words.distractors: A periodical publication with articles and images,A daily printed publication of news,An electronic device for processing data

words.translation: An instrument for writing or drawing with ink, typically consisting of a point or nib
words.distractors: A thin stick of graphite for writing or drawing,A marker with colored felt tip,A brush used for painting

courses.name: Travel English
courses.description: Useful words and phrases for travelers

words.translation: A piece of paper or card giving a right to travel or enter a place

words.translation: Suitcases, bags, and containers holding a traveler's belongings

words.translation: A journey made by or in an aircraft

words.translation: A form of rail transport consisting of connected vehicles running on a track

words.translation: A diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea showing features

words.translation: The system of money in general use in a particular country

courses.name: Sentence with a gap
courses.description: Choose the correct word that fits the sentence

words.text: I ___ a great movie last night.
If I ___ you, I would study more.
He has ___ to London many times.
The window was ___ by the wind.
